Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.7999137]Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=2.5 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=10 µg/ml), Bacillus subtilis (MIC=10 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=25 µg/ml), Shigella dysentariae (MIC=25 µg/ml), Pseudomonas putida (MIC=100 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC=100 µg/ml), Eshchericia coli (MIC=75 µg/ml);Fungi:Saccharomyces cerevisiae (MIC=200 µg/ml), Candida albicans (MIC=200 µg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium (MIC=200 µg/ml), Proteus mirabilis (MIC>200 µg/ml), Serratia marcescens (MIC>200 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.7999137] It has 0.50% hemolytic activity at 0.1 μg/ml, 0.74% hemolytic activity at 1 μg/ml, 0.78% hemolytic activity at 10 μg/ml, 1.67% hemolytic activity at 100 μg/ml against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: In 100% H2O, Gaegurin 4 contains a nascent turn near its C-terminal Rana box. Under a more hydrophobic condition it forms two amphipathic helices, one long encompassing residues 2-23 and the other consisting of residues 25-34 (Ref.2).
Sequence Information.Function: Has a broad spectrum of activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, fungi and protozoa. Has hemolytic activity against rabbit red cells.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin of a Korean frog, Rana rugosa.
Literature.Author: Park JM, Jung JE, Lee BJ.

Literature.Title: Solution structure and membrane interaction mode of an antimicrobial peptide gaegurin 4.
Literature.Author: Chi SW, Kim JS, Kim DH, Lee SH, Park YH, Han KH.

Literature.Title: Structural organization and expression of the gaegurin 4 gene of Rana rugosa.
Literature.Author: Kwon SY, Carlson BA, Park JM, Lee BJ.
